Text.Value: All in a day's work.
Huh. Plenty with tiefling villains... but not so many heroes, no.
Your job is to get up there and give me something real to sing about.
You should play The Weeping Dawn instead.
I don't fancy my chances. They're cute but deadly. Like the Realms' most terrifying bunny rabbits.

EditorData.NodeContext: Joking. You're messing with the player.

Text.Value: If today's to be something worth singing about - get up there and make sure it's a happy song.

EditorData.NodeContext: Thoughtful, trying to force a bit of cheer

Text.Value: Now's a time for cheerful lies, as my master would say.
Leave.
Gods, no. Can't see how a grown woman sobbing is going to lighten the mood much.
I'm an amnesiac, and even I know that's not the true story of Balduran.
I've heard a very different version of the tale of Balduran.
Just... be safe up there.
Do you know any stories about tiefling heroes?
If heroes are in short supply, then I will bloody well make one up. For them, and for me.
I suppose you'll just have to get up there and change that. No pressure, kin.
Well, they're eating up that fiction you just spun.
I could always scare them off. Maybe roar a little, for good measure?
I'd best continue with the stories, for fear of inciting a rebellion. But come back safe, all right?

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling at the beginning. A pause between last line. Sincere. she's worried about the player.

Text.Value: Fascinating. I suppose trying times lead to desperate measures. Could I watch?
But making enough noise to keep this little mob distracted? That I can help with.
But, truly... thank you. It's nice to be done with the sad songs, for a time.
Live through the day and you might even get to hear the finished thing.
As a halfling's hoof, I should hope.
Hardly going to be much use in a battle, am I?
I only seem to know the sad ones, and, well...
I'm... better, I think. Song's coming along, thanks to you.
What are you doing hiding down here?
Then slay the whelps before they have the chance.
You may, but unless you can spin a tale worthy of Milil, I suggest running while you can.

EditorData.NodeContext: Joking. You're messing with the player.

Text.Value: Why don't you play some music instead?
Get to the walls, beat the goblins back. Trust me - it's an easier job than this.
Yes...? I'm pretty certain if I stop for too long they will actually eat me.

EditorData.NodeContext: A whispered aside - she's worried about losing the childrens' already fading attention

Text.Value: The details of your story seem a little fuzzy.
On to playing for coppers on the corners of Baldur's Gate. I can hardly stand the glamour.
I suppose you'll just have to get up there and change that. No pressure, kin.
Good to see you again. How are you holding up?
I'm going to have to write a song about you now, aren't I?
Hah! I'd pay good money to see you try. They're cute but deadly. Like the Realms' most terrifying bunny rabbits.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cheery and delighted. Leaning like it's a secret.

Synopsis: Alfira is trying to distract the children from battle preparations going on around them.
